body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Rust are you using (`rustc --version`)?
rustc 1.22.0-nightly (dead08cb3 2017-09-08)

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using?
MacBook Pro mac 10.12.6(Sierra)  2.5 GHz Intel Core i7

3. What did you do?
make static_release
The local git revision id is: 
60265ecf7cdda5a5c44663da37d7afaade60c450

4. What did you expect to see?
build successfully without error msg

5. What did you see instead?
```
~deMacBook-Pro:tikv zhangwenjing$ make static_release
ROCKSDB_SYS_STATIC=1 ROCKSDB_SYS_PORTABLE=1 ROCKSDB_SYS_SSE=1  make release
cargo build --release --features "default static-link portable sse"
    Updating git repository `https://github.com/pingcap/kvproto.git`
   Compiling tikv v0.9.0 (file:///Users/zhangwenjing/Downloads/opensource/pingcap/tikv)
   Compiling kvproto v0.0.1 (https://github.com/pingcap/kvproto.git#4f4d24c1)
error[E0599]: no method named `call_once` found for type `alloc::boxed::Box<for<'r> alloc::boxed::FnBox<(&'r mut C,), Output=()> + std::marker::Send + 'static>` in the current scope
   --> src/util/threadpool.rs:280:26
    |
280 |                 (t.task).call_once((&mut self.ctx,));
    |                          ^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: the method `call_once` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
            `&alloc::boxed::Box<for<'r> alloc::boxed::FnBox<(&'r mut C,), Output=()> + std::marker::Send> : std::ops::FnOnce<_>`
            `&mut alloc::boxed::Box<for<'r> alloc::boxed::FnBox<(&'r mut C,), Output=()> + std::marker::Send + 'static> : std::ops::FnOnce<_>`
            `&for<'r> alloc::boxed::FnBox<(&'r mut C,), Output=()> + std::marker::Send : std::ops::FnOnce<_>`
            `&mut for<'r> alloc::boxed::FnBox<(&'r mut C,), Output=()> + std::marker::Send + 'static : std::ops::FnOnce<_>`

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `tikv`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
make[1]: *** [release] Error 101
make: *** [static_release] Error 2
```
title: compile error on Mac
